intro: Clompanus caribaea, commonly known as the Caribbean hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in soft, hairy textures, while its flowers bloom during the summer months. Clompanus caribaea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some parts of its native range.
